11#ifndef RTC_BASE_ASYNC_INVOKER_INL_H_
12#define RTC_BASE_ASYNC_INVOKER_INL_H_
13
14#include "api/scoped_refptr.h"
15#include "rtc_base/event.h"
16#include "rtc_base/message_handler.h"
17#include "rtc_base/ref_counted_object.h"
18#include "rtc_base/third_party/sigslot/sigslot.h"
19#include "rtc_base/thread.h"
20#include "rtc_base/thread_annotations.h"
21
22namespace rtc {
23
24class DEPRECATED_AsyncInvoker;
25
26// Helper class for AsyncInvoker. Runs a task and triggers a callback
27// on the calling thread if necessary.
28class AsyncClosure {
29 public:
30 explicit AsyncClosure(DEPRECATED_AsyncInvoker* invoker);
31 virtual ~AsyncClosure();
32 // Runs the asynchronous task, and triggers a callback to the calling
33 // thread if needed. Should be called from the target thread.
34 virtual void Execute() = 0;
35
36 protected:
37 DEPRECATED_AsyncInvoker* invoker_;
38 // Reference counted so that if the AsyncInvoker destructor finishes before
39 // an AsyncClosure's destructor that's about to call
40 // "invocation_complete_->Set()", it's not dereferenced after being
41 // destroyed.
42 rtc::Ref<Event>::Ptr invocation_complete_;
43};
44
45// Simple closure that doesn't trigger a callback for the calling thread.
46template <class FunctorT>
47class FireAndForgetAsyncClosure : public AsyncClosure {
48 public:
49 explicit FireAndForgetAsyncClosure(DEPRECATED_AsyncInvoker* invoker,
50 FunctorT&& functor)
51 : AsyncClosure(invoker), functor_(std::forward<FunctorT>(functor)) {}
52 virtual void Execute() { functor_(); }
53
54 private:
55 typename std::decay<FunctorT>::type functor_;
56};
57
58} // namespace rtc
59
60#endif // RTC_BASE_ASYNC_INVOKER_INL_H_
61
